titleStmt.title: Arbasto The anatomie of fortune. Wherein is discoursed by a pithie and pleasant discourse, that the highest state of prosperitie, is oft times the first steppe to mishappe, and that to stay vpon fortunes lotte, is to treade on brittle glasse. VVherein also gentlemen may finde pleasant conceits to purge melancholie, and perfit counsell to preuent misfortune. By Robert Greene Master of Arte.
titleStmt.author: Greene, Robert, 1558?-1592.

titleStmt.title: Arbasto The anatomie of fortune. Wherein is discoursed by a pithie and pleasant discourse, that the highest state of prosperitie, is oft times the first steppe to mishappe, and that to stay vpon fortunes lotte, is to treade on brittle glasse. VVherein also gentlemen may finde pleasant conceits to purge melancholie, and perfit counsell to preuent misfortune. By Robert Greene Master of Arte.
titleStmt.author: Greene, Robert, 1558?-1592.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by [J. Charlewood for] H. Iackson, dwelling in Fleetstreete, beneath the Conduite, at the signe of Saint Iohn Euangelist,

notesStmt.note: Running title reads: The anatomie of fortune.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
